4. $PLTR | Palantir

Orchestrating Real-Time Intelligence for Autonomous Systems

Palantir rounds out the group because robotics at scale requires real-time data integration, decision-support systems, fleet orchestration and safety oversight since robots are only as effective as the operational context they operate within and Palantir has quietly become the operating layer for critical infrastructure customers that depend on autonomous systems. 

Manufacturing lines, defense robotics, drone swarms, logistics networks and energy-site automation all rely on Palantir‚Äôs ability to fuse sensor data, run simulations, monitor risk and execute decisions with human oversight.

As robotics expands across national security and critical infrastructure then Palantir becomes the framework that ensures these systems behave reliably in high-stakes environments. The AI agents that Palantir deploys across industrial workflows will become the coordination layer between thousands of autonomous machines making it one of the most leveraged software plays in the robotics economy.

Heading into 2026, it‚Äôs worth remembering that while the market already knows what the major breakthroughs are across drones, space, quantum & nuclear, it continues to misprice the timing. 

Returns get pulled forward too early, patience fades during the inevitable digestion phase & investors step away before the decade-long compounding cycle truly begins. 

Which is why investors in $RKLB, $ASTS, $OKLO, $IONQ, $ONDS & $EOSE should be paying attention.

2026 WILL BE THE YEAR OF SPACE

A SpaceX IPO in 2026 would put the entire $1.8T space economy under its brightest spotlight yet with every layer of the ecosystem getting repriced: 

‚Ä¢ $RKLB building an end-to-end space logistics 
‚Ä¢ $PL monetizing continuous Earth data from orbit
‚Ä¢ $ASTS turning space into a global cellular network
‚Ä¢ $RDW supplying the picks-and-shovels of orbital infrastructure

TOP GROWTH THEMES TO WATCH IN 2026

‚Ä¢ Crypto | $HOOD, $COIN, $BMNR
‚Ä¢ Quantum | $IONQ, $RGTI, $QBTS
‚Ä¢ Robotics | $TSLA, $SYM, $ISRG, $RR
‚Ä¢ Nuclear | $OKLO, $LEU, $GEV, $UUUU
‚Ä¢ AI Utility | $CRWV, $NBIS, $IREN, $CIFR
‚Ä¢ AI Chips | $NVDA, $TSM, $ASML, $AMD
‚Ä¢ Grid & Power | $CEG, $NEE, $VST, $EOSE
‚Ä¢ Drones | $ONDS, $UMAC, $DPRO, $AVAV
‚Ä¢ AI Data Platforms | $PLTR, $SNOW, $MDB
‚Ä¢ AI Security | $CRWD, $ZS, $PANW, $RBRK
‚Ä¢ Space Economy | $RKLB, $ASTS, $PL, $RDW
‚Ä¢ AI Networking | $AVGO, $ALAB, $MRVL, $CRDO
‚Ä¢ AI Cloud | $MSFT, $AMZN, $GOOGL, $DOCN, $ORCL
$TSM received annual U.S. approval to continue exporting chipmaking equipment to China

$TSLA Supercharger network is scaling like an energy business with delivered power rising from ~1 TWh a few years ago to ~7 TWh by 2025.

That‚Äôs the kind of infrastructure fleets and autonomous systems actually depend on.
Polymarket is pricing an 11% chance of Ethereum $ETH hitting $10K in 2026

THE INFORMATION‚ÄôS 3 AI PREDICTIONS FOR 2026

‚Ä¢ $GOOGL Gemini catches up to ChatGPT in weekly active users & acquires Thinking Machines Lab to deepen core AI research
‚Ä¢ OpenAI launches an automated AI research intern by late 2026 but it falls short of expectations
‚Ä¢ One major AI lab rolls out a $1,000-per-month AI agent to see how much businesses are really willing to pay

I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôll buy next ‚Äî and that‚Äôs the point.

Markets speak in signals, not CNBC type outlooks.

Our mission is to provide early, actionable market insights to the public ‚Äì in 2025, this meant preparing readers for the April drawdown two months in advance, calling the August top in crypto, and surfacing under-the-radar AI companies positioned for outsized returns.

Below, we review our quarter-by-quarter research from 2025 and the critical themes shape our positioning heading into 2026.
io-fund.com/ai-stocks/nvidia‚Ä¶

Samsung and SK hynix have reportedly raised HBM3e supply prices by ~20% for 2026, following the reapproval of exports of Nvidia‚Äôs $NVDA H200 GPU to China and the upcoming ramp of Google‚Äôs $GOOG TPU v7 and Amazon‚Äôs $AMZN Trainium3. 

$MU $AMD

xAI has bought a third building in Memphis to expand its AI training capacity to nearly 2GW, with the company aiming to scale its Colossus cluster to at least 1M GPUs. 

$NVDA $ORCL $AMZN $MSFT $GOOG

Soaring memory prices are expected to push memory chipmaker profitability beyond that of foundries next quarter, with Samsung, SK Hynix and Micron $MU all guiding for gross margins from 63-67%, above TSMC‚Äôs $TSM 60% guide.
